citeinfo.title: Predictions of Future Mean-Annual Precipitation from Five Climate Models and Two Future Greenhouse Gas Emissions Scenarios for Three Climatology Periods
Development of Flood Regressions and Climate Change Scenarios to Explore Estimates of Future Peak Flows

descript.abstract: The 30 datasets include future mean-annual precipitations from five downscaled models for two Representative Concentration Pathways (RCP) emission scenarios, RCP4.5 and RCP8.5 that were conducted under the Climate Model Intercomparision Program (CMIP5) developed for the Fifth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC AR5). Each of the precipitation projections were averaged into three climatology periods: 2025-2049, 2050-2074, and 2075-2099.
descript.purpose: The datasets were collected and assembled to explore the role of future climate change on the magnitude of flood peaks for stream and rivers in New York and the Champlain Basin of Vermont. The datasets are used in this application: Burns, D.A., Smith, M.J., and Freehafer, D.A., 2015, Application of flood regressions and climate change scenarios to explore estimates of future peak flows (version 1.0): U.S. Geological Survey data release, ​​https://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7WS8R9S
descript.supplinf: A table of names, abbreviations, and references that describe the climate models, greenhouse‐gas scenarios, and time periods used to generate the 30 raster datasets of mean‐annual precipitation and runoff downscaled to an 800‐meter grid that covers all of New York State plus Lake Champlain watershed used by the Web application is available at: https://ny.water.usgs.gov/maps/floodfreq-climate/README.rcp45_85pr_CompletePRECIPin.pdf

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.
